headline: BNY beats estimates, stays mum on merger rumors
summary: CEO Robin Vince refused to comment on "rumors or speculation" about a potential merger between the custody banking giant and its smaller rival, Northern Trust. He also said that the bar for BNY to engage in M&A is "very high."

raw.headline: BNY beats estimates, stays mum on merger rumors

headline: Could M&A Be in BNY’s Future? What CEO Robin Vince Says.
summary: Bank of New York Mellon is open to acquisitions if the right opportunity arises, but is focused on executing its current strategy, says CEO Robin Vince.  Vince, who was responding to an analyst question during his company’s earnings call, declined to comment on a recent Wall Street Journal article that reported that BNY approached Northern Trust about a potential acquisition.  Acquiring Northern Trust would provide BNY a large wealth management business that caters to ultrawealthy families, but integrating it would be a challenge.
